comments.text:
Of course, as every couple is unique, every wedding will be different as 
well.  Some people get married on the beach, others in a huge Cathedral.  I 
myself got married at the local court house with our parents and two best 
friends in attendance.  But in general, this video is poking fun at many of 
the cliche wedding traditions in America.  Weddings are a multimillion 
dollar industry in this country.  Some people spend literally hundreds of 
thousands of dollars on their weddings.  A large/ expensive wedding tends 
to have several bridesmaids and an even number of groomsmen.  Having a 
weddings party (bridesmaids/ groomsmen) is a way of including those close 
to the couple (best friends, siblings) in the production an American 
wedding can be.
The bachelor/ bachelorette party (or stag/ hen party, to use a more 
old-fashioned term) is, I think, a celebration of a single persons last 
party being single.  It is not always held the night before the wedding, 
but it is usually within a week or two of the nuptials.  It's considered a 
way to live it up before being anchored to "the old ball and chain", in 
other words, before committing oneself to a lifetime of fidelity to one 
individual.  Men traditionally go to a strip club or have a stripper come 
to them.  There is lots of drinking and whatever else one might be expected 
to give up as a married person.  Bachelorette parties are a newer tradition 
which I think stems from the feminist perspective that what's good for the 
goose is good for the gander.  Women sometimes go to a male strip club or 
have a male stripper at the party, or they may just have drinking and 
dancing.  The genital cake is usually something found at bachelorette  
parties.  I think it probably has ties to the whole antiquated notion of a 
bride being a virgin until she is married.  Penis cakes and straws are 
supposed to be a funny way of introducing a young innocent to "this is 
what's in your future!".  Of course, very few women are virgins on their 
wedding day in this day and age, so it's also another way of saying, 
"goodbye to all those penises in your past, now you'll only get to see one 
for the rest of your life."  It's all in good fun and honestly, I don't 
know that either bachelor or bachelorette parties are as common as 
Hollywood would have us believe.
If you are really interested in the subject, check out the movies "The 
Hangover" and "Bridesmaids".  Both huge hits in this country.
comments.author: mtugglet

comments.text: Its a show on tv
comments.author: TheCubanchica250

comments.text:
In Switzerland some people also have a stag / hen night, but I've never 
heard of anybody having it right before the wedding. Anyway, the part with 
the genitalia straws makes sense, I guess. Thanks :)
The wedding entourage still leaves me a bit bewildered, I guess because we 
just don't really do it, or at least I've never seen or heard of it, not 
even with really big weddings... Trauzeugen (witnesses, they used to be 
required) are still rather common, which would mean one best man and one 
bridesmaid, if the couple can't decide they might have two each, but that's 
it. I guess the whole notion is just strange to me.
But thanks for explaining:)
comments.author: Taylor H

comments.text: +John Ace Brown aw thanks xD
comments.author: ellie treecat

comments.text:
+ellie treecat You explained that so much better than I did. Thank you for 
existing. XD
comments.author: John Ace Brown

comments.text:
+Leontine Meier Yes some weddings are like this.
Usually in big weddings the bridesmaids and groomsmen are close friends, 
siblings and possibly cousins or close family. These kinds of weddings 
involve inviting 100+ people of extended family and friends on both sides 
and their dates. 
The partying thing can range depending on how reserved the marrying couple 
are but usually drinking is involved, either at home or at bars/clubs, and 
it is usually planned by the best man and best woman. It is a "last night 
out" to let loose before marriage. As for the genitalia thing it is a 
sexual humor that is an extreme version of wedding parties. Mostly college 
age individuals do this and people who are very open about sexuality and 
sexual humor. It's not that common.
comments.author: ellie treecat

comments.text:
The genitalia cake and straws are simply adults who aren't mature enough to 
actually function in life properly. Yeah, it's disgusting. But in defense 
of Americans, most people don't do that.
As for the partying, I don't know. I would guess it's their form of 
celebration before the big day. I'm under aged and wouldn't do it if I 
could anyway. Again, it's just adults doing stupid things. I've never heard 
of people going out and partying before the wedding day.
There are so many people because in American weddings it's customary to 
invite family and close friends. So that's family and friends on both the 
groom's side and the bride's side.
I hope this helped at least a little. ^^'
comments.author: John Ace Brown

comments.text:
So some weddings really are like that in America? Interesting...
I'm from Switzerland, and this video is rather weird to me. I mean, why is 
the entourage that important and why are there so many people in it? It's 
not like they are really needed for the wedding, after all.
And why would anybody go out partying the day before the wedding when they 
know pictures will be taken? Or why would anybody want to have cake and 
straws formed like genitalia? That's utterly confusing!
comments.author: Taylor H

comments.text: It's just cultural differences. Where are you from? :)

comments.text:
I think it was funny because in reality these men were acting like women. 
Which made it seem ridiculous because men are not as "fussy" "emotional" 
"caddy" when it comes to weddings. I think we should let it shine as what 
it was, a parody by means of switching gender roles. That is actually how 
most women act during the wedding process, note I did not say ALL. But 
seeing it through the eyes of men was hilarious. The women acting as 
groomsmen was great. The juxtaposition had me laughing the whole video. Lol 
The whispered spat between best man and bitter groomsmaid was the best lol

comments.author: Burt C0caine

comments.text:
Well, I think it's also joking about the ways we expect and/or assume women 
act, and how these things often seem strange and ridiculous to us if we see 
men doing them. There are certainly plenty of women who don't behave this 
way (and probably plenty of men who, to a certain extent, do). I personally 
can't imagine ever being brought to tears by the sight of one of my friends 
or sisters in a wedding dress, and I don't think I'd ever want to be the 
maid of honour (or even a bridesmaid probably).

captions.text: (urinates)
- Oh my god.
- Ella and Eugene are getting married!
- Effing...
- Way.
- So I guess you probably figured out
why I invited all of you here.
Will you be my groomsmen?
- Yes, yes!

- So obviously, Steve
is gonna be my best man.
- What?

- Oh my god, look at these,
they're one of a kind!

- I was best man at my
brother's wedding, so...

- Oh, that's really wonderful.
- [Male friend] Steve,

if you need any hot tips,
I got you covered bro!

- Oh, no man, don't worry
about it, I got this.
- Who the (bleep) does Max think he is?
- Um, who's this?
- Oh, this is my cousin, Justin.
- To best friends.
Yo, I don't know why I'm not the best man.
I'm Eugene's cousin, I don't know.
- Best friends.
- [Max] Steven is in way over his head.

He's gonna get overwhelmed
and drop the ball,

and when he does I'll
be there to scoop it up.
- We should probably see what the
bridesmaids look like, right?
- On it.
Look at those arms.

- Let's see, what's her
relationship status say?
Oh, she doesn't have it.

I really hope I find love
at this wedding, you know?
Maybe even get married myself, who knows?

- If you don't like this place
you don't have to go here.
- Come on, let's go.
- It's like a cool, Brazilian New Years.

- I think it's like a cool
Brazilian coke dealer.
- I mean, your butt looks great.
- [Eugene] Thanks.

- Nope, nope, no way, ew.
- [Steve] No!
- That looks good.
(all gasp)

- [Eugene] It's the one.
- [Max] Oh my god, it's so soft.
- [Eugene] Guys, don't mess up the suit.
I still have to buy it--
- Yeah, don't mess up the suit.

Steven, get off him.
- [Eugene] It's okay, but thank you.

- Are you ready to get
hot for this wedding?
- I'm ready to get hot for this wedding!
- Let's do it!
(fast workout music)
- I haven't eaten gluten in two months.
- Yeah, I'm on a strict liquid diet.
- I take three cold showers a day
because the shivering burns calories.

- Wait, our outfits are pink
oxfords and yellow bow ties?

- Are you kidding me, when am
I ever gonna wear that again?

- Just got a super
passive aggressive email
from Steve about the bachelor party.
It's probably gonna be really tacky.
(dance music)

- I can't believe you
guys got vagina straws.
- Surprise, surprise!
Vagina cake!

- Can we get five more
cosmos for us, thank you.
- Make that six!
Actually no, we're just gonna have five.
Justin, you're drunk.

- [Steve] That was a
70 dollar vagina cake.
The wedding is tomorrow and I can't wait

for it to be over because
I am losing my mind!
(alarm beeping)
It's here!
Wake up, ya sons of bitches!
We're already late!

- It's 4:30 in the morning.
- [Steve] Yes!
- Didn't wanna step on your toes,
but I was starting to wonder when you
were gonna wake up these sleepy heads.
- [All] You're getting married today!
- Alright, here ya go.

Get your coffee, we got
a big schedule ahead.
(glasses clink)
(knock on door)
Maid of honor's here!

- [Male friend] Oh god,
do not look at my hair.
- I have a card from Ella.
It's like a love note or something.
(gentle music)
- I can't find my suspenders.

- Somebody needs to go on
a run to the rental car.
- Everyone look for the keys first.
We can't find the keys.
- Got 'em.

- [Steve] Oh, thank you for
scaring the hell out of us.
- Why are you guys all dressed up?
- Are you kidding me right now?
- (mumbling) shirt!
- Everything okay out here?
- Everything's great.
- I need help with my suit.

- Did Steve tie this for you?
- That looks fantastic.
Yeah, I tied it.
- I'm sorry, I'm gonna retie it.
- No, it looks good.
- Because it looks like a blind person--

- Okay, you know what, can I
speak with you for a second?

Ever since he decided
that I was the best man,

you have been a negative
nancy and a pouty--
- I dunno what you're doing in his head.
You are singlehandedly trying to
take my best friend away from me!
- Someone hold my hair back.
- [Steve] Oh, god, oh god.
(girls cheering)
- [All] Ball and chain!

- You're never gonna
screw any guys ever again!
- Alright, three, two, one...
(violin music)
- Did the maid of honor, like, wake up
five minutes before this wedding started?
- Did she even care about this?
- God damn her arms in that dress.

- I mean, the one in the
middle is the lawyer, right?
(groomsmen gasp)
- [Officiant] Do you take Ella in sickness

and in health, as long
as you both shall live?
- [Eugene] I do.

- [Officiant] Ella, do you
take Eugene in sickness

and in health, as long
as you both shall live?
- [Ella] I do.
- [Officiant] You may kiss the groom.
(audience cheers)
